dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4526 IH: Stopping Lawless Actions of Politicians (SLAP) Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rokita introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide penalties for certain obstructions of the enforcement of Federal immigration laws.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping Lawless Actions of Politicians (SLAP) Act of 2017.

section.header: Certain Obstructions of Enforcement of Immigration Laws

subsection.text: Chapter 73 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following;

section.header: Certain obstructions of enforcement of immigration laws
section.text: Whoever, being a State or local official having custody of an individual, knowingly ignores a request from the Federal Government for the custody of that individual, if the requesting authority has designated that individual as a violator of the immigration laws, shall be fined under this title or imprisoned not more than five years, or both

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 73 is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1522. Certain obstructions of enforcement of immigration laws.
